718062f-a.title: Manhattan: Canal Street - Greenwich Street
718062f-a.text:
506, 508, 510-516 Canal Street, south side, between Greenwich and
Washington Streets.
March 8, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
718062f-a.folder: Canal Street & Greenwich Street, Manhattan, NY

718059f-a.title: Manhattan: Canal Street - Greenwich Street
718059f-a.text:
Canal Street, western end, from West to Greenwich Streets, looking
across what used to be the little park between the north fork
of Canal Street and the south fork (formerly Eoboken Street).
This little park is now being cleared off and made into a triangular
safety zone.
August 29, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
718059f-a.folder: Canal Street & Greenwich Street, Manhattan, NY

720228f-a.title: Manhattan: Greenwich Street - Canal Street
720228f-a.text:
481-489 Greenwich Street, at and adjoining the N.E. corner of Canal
Street, as viewed eastward from Washington Street, and thru clearance at the
S.E. corner of Canal Street.
July 26, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
720228f-a.folder: Greenwich Street & Canal Street, Manhattan, NY

718058f-b.title: Manhattan: Canal Street - Greenwich Street
718058f-b.text:
Canal Street, south side, east from Greenwich (9th Avae-e
"E;" thereon), to Matts (left) Streets, shoving a triangular
block bounded bv these thoroughfares. A former 4 storv
structure (No. 50O Canal and 477 Greenxich Streets)has been re-
placed by a gasoline station and opened to viex the side of
a frame house No. 475 Greenwich Street. Adjacent to same is
a siaular 2 1/2 story frame ouilding ithn brick front, bearing
No. 473. Across t'ese buildinas apoears lofts on the aouth
side of satts SEreet; the narrowerof which is to be rebuilt and
'ave a modern tra slucent glass front. For an account of same
see the Ne v York Times of October 20, 1937, pame 42 L.
V;w No. 2 shows details of tbe atructures occupying the
riddle of this block front. The narrow 2 story affAir at the
left is a rear ertrance to an addition to tbe aforerentioned
1 o 273 Greenwick Street. The ad foirinm oroperty (So's. 496
and 498 Canal Street) is composed of 2 units; ore, two stories
in heimyt and thie other, one story. Note the doorwav leading
into the hacl vard of the firat 2 1/2 story frame dwelling.
In this innstance the photographer is iewing towards Greenwich
Street and upon ehich apnear lofts on the vest side of same.
View No. 3 is sirular to No. 1. Note at the left the
ahaence of tw: d story brick structure and the cas station re-
pplacing same, thereby giving this front an additional vacancv.
The 12 story factory at that margin replaced the 3 story
pitched roof residences that ap ear to the left in 1c No. 1.
Qctober 25, 1927.
View 2: June 30, 1931

720227f-a.title: Manhattan: Greenwich Street - Canal Street
720227f-a.text:
475 Greenwich Street, adjoining the S.E. corner of Canal Street.
Building concerned is a 2-story frame house with a brick front.
About 1912.
Gift of Samuel Landsman.
